alert.note: Alert for Cameron; Vermilion (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 08 at 1:54PM CDT until September 08 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lake Charles has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Cameron Parish in southwestern Louisiana... Vermilion Parish in southwestern Louisiana... * Until 300 PM CDT. * At 153 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Lunita to near Westlake to near Welsh to near Maurice, moving south at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Cameron, Kaplan, Gueydan, Grand Lake, Rockefeller Wildlife Range, Freshwater City, Forked Island, Johnsons Bayou, Intracoastal City, Lacassine National Wildlife Refuge, Sabine National Wildlife, Pecan Island, Grand Chenier, Klondike, Erath, Delcambre, Maurice, Hacketts Corner, and Wright. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. If on or near Lake Charles and Prien Lake, get away from the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 15 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
